subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.

-------------------------------1242856092
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="UTF-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Language: en

I have a great idea, why don't one of the wealthier  people on this list 
c=
reate a company, give it a fancy name, like Angel Feather's  Spirit Network=
 
or AFSN for short, and we can all work for you  :)   The good Lord knows =
I 
need a job where I can work from   home. <G>sf
 






In a message date=
d 5/20/2009 4:56:56 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time,  
april@abercrombieghostres=
earch.com writes:

 
 


=EF=BB=BF  
I don't think they would have to know =
this  to make it happen. We already 
know it happens and I bet that the spi=
rit  doesn't know exactly how it 
accomplished it.
 
Sure, there could be a=
nother factor that  we just don't know about that 
makes EVP possible.
 
"I=
t is much more credible for the signal to be manipulated near the AtoD  
co=
nverter (where EMF changes would have the most straighforward result) than =
 
in the digital media itself."
 
Ok well-there you have it.
 

----- Origi=
nal Message ----- 
From: _Rj_ (mailto:rasterer@...)   
To: _EVP-ITC@y=
ahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com)  
Sent: Wednesday, May 20,=
 2009 2:24  PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a  question.




Manipulat=
ing EMF is one thing.  But directly  storing bits on a media is 
way beyond=
 that.  Bits are not stored  in a continuous stream.  They are 
broken into=
 bytes (little  packets) that is totally controlled by the processor 
and  =
software.  For Elvis to "encode directly" to the media, he would  have 
to =
do what that software does to the digital signals coming in  from the AtoD =

converter: he would have to group the bits into (for  example) 16 little 
=
herds each, decide on the specific bit  interpretation scheme (2's 
complem=
ent?)   find space on the  media, update the media's dictionary of where th=
ere 
is free space and  where there isn't, link the herds together with som=
e sort 
of linked  pointer, skip around the areas marked 'bad' on the media=
, update  
things like date/time modified and size, respect any kind of own=
ership  
permissions on the media, and so on.

It is much more credible  fo=
r the signal to be manipulated near the AtoD 
converter (where EMF  changes=
 would have the most straighforward result) than 
in the digital  media its=
elf.

--- On Wed, 5/20/09, April Abercrombie  
<april@abercrombieghapril@ab=
ercrapr>  wrote:


From:  April Abercrombie  <april@abercrombieghapril@aber=
crapr>
Subject: Re:  [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
To:  EVP-ITC@yahoogro=
upsTo: 
Date: Wednesday, May 20, 2009, 1:05  PM


 
=EF=BB=BF  
"Probably n=
ot "directly", since that would mean grandma would  have to have 
quite an =
understanding of digital encoding, including  which bits mean 
what, when, =
and where."
 
Not necessarily- maybe it is  that just by trying to communic=
ate through 
our equipment, it  happens automatically. They don't have to r=
ealize that they 
are  manipulating the EMF to make it occur, it just happe=
ns. It's the  
nature of being of pure energy.
 

-----  Original Message -=
---- 
From:  _Rj_ (mip://03f5cd00/mc/compose?to=3Drasterer@...)  
To:=
  _EVP-ITC@yahoogroups  .com_ 
(mip://03f5cd00/mc/compose?to=3DEVP-ITC@yaho=
ogroups.com)  
Sent:  Wednesday, May 20, 2009 1:55 PM
Subject:  Re: [EVP-IT=
C] Re: I have a question.




Probably not "directly", since that would  me=
an grandma would have to have 
quite an understanding of  digital encoding,=
 including which bits mean what, 
when, and  where.  But even on a digital =
recorder, there is still  an 
analog element (the Analog to Digital convert=
er) which  takes the sound pressure 
waves, as represented by some  analog =
electronic detection element, and 
converts that into  digital.  That way, =
long departed uncle Ebenezer does  not 
need to do anything digital.  Under=
 this scenario,  if sound is not being 
heard in the room, but is being  in=
duced into the circuitry, then it would be 
round about  that AtoD converte=
r (assuming it isn't other just plain old  
noise in the digital elements).=
  

Someone with  more electronic know-how than me might be able to better =
 
pinpoint the area in the analog portion of that AtoD  pipeline where it w=
ould 
be most likely it could be  influenced by, say, an EM field, and that=
 would 
also occur  in a normal analog tape recorder.


--- On  Wed, 5/20/0=
9, April Abercrombie  <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. 
com>  wrote:


Fro=
m:  April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch.  com>
Subject: Re: =
[EVP-ITC] Re: I have a  question.
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date:  Wedne=
sday, May 20, 2009, 12:29 PM


 
This is what I think  true EVP is Eric. No=
t and actual sound emitting a 
sound  wave in the environment, but EMF mani=
pulation in order to  imprint the 
message directly to the recording media.=
 It  doesn't matter if it is analog 
or digital.
 
If the sound that is  re=
corded emitted a sound wave in the physical 
environment,  then it is reall=
y a disembodied voice, and not true  EVP.
 

-----  Original Message ----- =

From:  Eric  VanDuzer 
To:  EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
Sent:  Wednesday, Ma=
y 20, 2009 11:16 AM
Subject:  Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.



Actua=
lly that I would buy into  But the question  I have when you say 
"tape" ar=
e you talking old analog  tape or digi recording.  Here is the reason I  
b=
elieve it can be do "real-time".  As you all know  we use electromagnetic 
=
Field detectors in field  investigations.  If a spirit can manipulate that =
 
with to show that they are there by giving off a EM  field whose to say t=
hey 
can't manipulate a magnetic  strip of a tape or even the electronics i=
n a 
Digi  recorder to speak in "real-time".

On Wed, May 20, 2009 at 1:01 =
PM,  Kristin Morris <ckmorris95@sbcgloba 
l.net>  wrote:


 
 



Okay  I h=
ave another one for you to think about.. I tape a  session and 
review it l=
ater..  even a day  later.  Upon review the message that comes over  
is ab=
out something that =E2=80=98just happened=E2=80=99 while I was  reviewing o=
r happened 
after taping?  Is it  possible that spirit can manipulate the r=
ecording  
AFTER recording has stopped or even manipulate the  audio while =
reviewing? 
An  give you an example of this I was recording one day  and I =
reviewed the 
audio the next day.  While  reviewing =E2=80=93 about half wa=
y through =E2=80=93 the 
message =E2=80=9CYour  mother is calling=E2=80=9D =
was found.  I saved it and  moved on and 
within two seconds my mom called.=
   You say it is a coincidence except that I hadn
=E2=80=99t  spoken to my =
mother in over a year.  During this  same conversation 
with her =E2=80=93 =
we sorta made amends and  I told her the story of the =E2=80=98secret=E2=80=
=99 I 
had found out  about a family member having a child out of wedlock i=
n  the 
late 1920s.  Quick backstory.. I found out  about this out-of-wedlo=
ck birth 
through my genealogy  research and contacted spirit through the b=
ox and I  was 
promptly told to keep it secret and which I  promised to do=
=E2=80=A6 
Well  in this conversation with my mom after not speaking  for a=
 year I 
told her what I had found out.  When  the telephone conversation e=
nded with my 
mom=E2=80=A6 I was  amazed that the recording had told me she=
 would call  right be 
fore she did =E2=80=93 even though the audio was  re=
corded the previous day.  I 
proceeded to go  back to reviewing the audio a=
nd the very first thing I  heard 
was:  THAT WAS SUPPOSED TO BE A SECRET =
=E2=80=93  YOU LIED. 
Maybe  they can manipulate =E2=80=98real-time=E2=80=
=99 literally???  ? 
k

=
 




2  different things happening-that' s why. When you get  EVP that eve=
ryone 
understands,  it is outward, in  the environment. Not a communicatio=
n 
through  subconscious means.
 

 
EVP  that people swear they hear, but =
noone else can make  sense, may be a 
message to them via subconscious  mea=
ns. That isn't to say that ALL EVP's 
like this are  true messages, I am su=
re alot are just  matrixing.
 

 
But  then that is how the art of scrying =
starts-matrixing.  Like the 
Rorschach tests. The images you matrix with  t=
hose gives the psychologist an 
insight into your  mind.
 

 
By  gazing in=
to a dark, reflective surface, you start to  see cloudy 
images. At first, =
you will just be  matrixing faces in the clouds and not getting 
much  subs=
tance. Try it, you will see what I am saying. With  practice, you 
start to=
 see clear, concise  images.
 

 
I  think that is what happening with audi=
o as  well.
 

 
We  already know for a fact pareidolia can occur in audio =
 as well as 
visual stimulus.

yes I understand its  personal to that particular i=
ndividual but why can't

s through the traditional

g of that matter) that all  
others have heard.

 12:15 PM, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh 
ostresearch.  com> wrote=
: 
 
 
 
 
 
 
"If one person is not meant  to hear it they won't hear it (=
I guess I am 
not  quite ready to believe that one right  yet)." 
 


 
I  =
don't know for sure about that one either, but I am  not ready to 
discount=
 it either, especially  since I stumbled across the possibility of  
audibl=
e scrying. But I am sure alot of people don't  believe in scrying at all  
=
either.
 

 
What  makes it a possibility to me is that so many people  are=
 hearing 
things that are very personal, but stuff  they would not have com=
e up with on 
their  own.

From:=
 Eric  VanDuzer

 =



 
 
I think that is the  problem I am having though Jim.  When you say  =
"work 
them over till you hear them"  to me I  should not have to work them=
 over 
till I hear  them.  Yes taking out the ambient and  background noise=
 is one 
thing.  But if you  just keep on listening to them with different =
 enhancements 
you are bound to hear something  (matrixing).  If one person=
 is not meant 
to  hear it they won't hear it (I guess I am not quite  read=
y to believe that 
one right yet).  I  think you all know what I am getting=
 at.    
 
On Tue, May 19, 2009 at  9:11 PM, James W. Hyslope <clockdryve@y=
ahoo. com>  
wrote: 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Well, for myself...I don't  "clean" them u=
p to much because I really don't  
know HOW :) (well a little bit)Since I'v=
e only  been at it for a couple 
weeks. BUT if you can  clean up something =
to where you can FIND what was  there 
to begin with "you have done no harm=
" I hear  alot more than others I 
guess, and I haven't  enhanced many of m=
y evp's.*If anyone is able to  clean them 
up...I DO promise you will hear =
what I  say is correct)Pretty BOLD 
statement, but if you  are able to clea=
n it up with better software  (please do for 
others too) I will be more th=
an  happy to "listen" where I made a 
mistake...I can  only LEARN from it :=
) I have done some DEEP  enhancements to a few of 
my evp's...from the  beg=
ining I could only hear clicks and  thumps.....but 
after messing with that=
 area,  eventually I would hear the true voices (and 
can  tell if male or =
female...approximat e age) and  understand the mood 
also....these where ex=
treamly  modified, and I feel that I could NOT have added 
 enough "simple"=
 enhancements that would ADD a  voice....full of emotion 
and distinct syll=
ables :)  And some just can't hear them for what ever reason  
be it equipm=
ent that is used to hear  (pc-headphones- speakers- ears) know 
one has the=
  perfect match of all these things. Check out  "Jim's RR-DR60 
EVP's" in t=
he files section....work  them over till you hear them. I really 
can't do =
 much more :)--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com, Eric  VanDuzer 
<evanduzer@..=
 .>  wrote:
>

ings. I do  
clean
> up evps if I hear something and  can't make it out do =
to ambient noise. So

 Wouldn't to much
> enhancing "taint" the  results? To me the more enhancin=
g you do the  less

ive, it is not meant

t  is that if you 
have to
> do so much  enhancing to find anything, was th=
ere really  something there 
to

 believe there is something  
there??
> 
>  Eric
